intro: Korthalsella dichotoma var. balansae, commonly known as the Balansae korthalsella, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its dichotomous branching pattern and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
